results.title: Freaks
results.brief_description: This controversial film was banned for over thirty years in some countries, including Australia. Using a group of circus and carnival performers who were all regarded as “freaks of nature” this unsettling film is about a malicious young woman who weds a carnival manager in order to gain his wealth. Her cruel treatment of the various circus performers prompts them to exact a vicious revenge. The final scenes in this movie are possibly some of the most harrowing in horror cinema history.

results.title: Frasquita
results.brief_description: Based on an operetta by Austrian composer Franz Lehar with lyrics by A.M. Willner and H. Reichert, “Frasquita” tells the romantic tale of a love triangle between Harald, a wealthy young Parisian (Hans Heinz Bollmann), his fiancee Dolly (Charlott Daudert) and Frasquita (Jarmila Novotna) a young gyspy girl who takes Harald’s fancy after a chance meeting. Music conducted by Franz Lehar. Cast also includes Heinz Ruhmann, Max Gulstorff, Hans Moser, Rudolf Carl, Franz Schafheitlin. Dialogue, lyrics and credits in German. No English subtitles.

results.title: Fraser's River
results.creator_credit: Tim Wilson, ONF | NFB and Gordon Sparling
results.brief_description: This film traces the Fraser River from its source in the Rocky Mountains to its mouth, where the city of Vancouver stands. The influence of the Fraser as a provincial lifeline of commerce and communication, and as a transportation link with the rest of Canada, is shown.

results.title: Frantic
results.creator_credit: Mount Company, Warner Bros Pictures, Thom Mount, Tim Hampton and Roman Polanski
results.brief_description: Dr. Richard Walker (Harrison Ford), an American cardiologist, is plunged into an emotional nightmare when he discovers his wife has mysteriously vanished during their visit to Paris. He sets out to find her, and begins to fear the city itself as he grapples with a bewildering web of language, locale, laissez-faire cops and indifferent bureaucrats. Walker’s only chance at finding his wife alive seems to rest with a streetwise waif with underworld connections (Emmanuelle Seigner). Cast also includes Betty buckley, JHohn Mahoney, Jimmie Ray Weeks, David Huddleston.

results.title: Franklin River journey
results.creator_credit: Anne Whitehead, Tasmanian Film Corporation and Bob Connolly
results.brief_description: This film depicts a three week journey down the Franklin River by botanist Antonius Moscal. Portrays his appreciation of the environment and the studies which he carries out. Suitable for Middle Secondary level. Narration by John Bluthal.

results.title: Franklin River blockade
results.creator_credit: Nick Housego, Kath Scholes and Roger Scholes
results.brief_description: Documents the massive non-violent civil disobedience against the building of the Gordon below Franklin Hydro-electric scheme between December 1982 and March 1983. It is the story of the largest peaceful direct action Australia has witnessed. It vividly portrays confrontation in a wilderness under threat a clash of attitudes. Includes interviews with Dick Smith, David Bellamy and Bob Brown.

results.title: Franklin
results.creator_credit: Nelvana, Neurones and John Van Bruggen
results.brief_description: Franklin is a young green turtle, who, like most youngsters is having fun growing up and learning important things as he goes. Three episodes show some of his adventures. In “Franklin’s Kite” Franklin learns that throwing out a broken toy is not always the best thing to do. “Franklin is Bossy” teaches Franklin that everyone has to take a turn and in “Finders Keepers for Franklin” he realizes that finding something means that somebody has lost it in the first place and may want it back.

results.title: Frankie Howerd on campus
results.creator_credit: Paul Lewis, LWT, ITV and Ian Hamilton
results.brief_description: Recorded live for television at The Oxford Union Society, Oxford University, this stand-up performance of one of Britain’s most outrageous and favourite comedians, Frankie Howerd, is thoroughly entertaining.

results.title: Frankie and Johnny
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, Nick Abdo and Garry Marshall
results.brief_description: This warm romantic comedy stars Michelle Pfeiffer as Frankie, a cynical waitress who is wooed by the gentle Johnny (Al Pacino), a recently released pretty criminal who takes a job as a chef in the restaurant in which Frankie works. Set around the working class neighbourhoods of New York City, the film is an engaging comedy about the fears and difficulties involved in learning to trust another person. Terrence McNally wrote the script which is based on his acclaimed play, “Frankie and Johnny in the Clair de Lune”. One of the great joys of this film are the uniformly excellent performances. The cast includes Kate Nelligan as Frankie’s fellow waitress; Nathan Lane as her generous spirited gay flat-mate; and the under-rated Hector Helizondo as Nick, the owner of the Greek restaurant in which Frankie and Johnny work.

results.title: Frankenstein's Great-aunt Tillie
results.creator_credit: Tillie Productions and Myron J. Gold
results.brief_description: Comical farce about descendants of Frankenstein’s creator returning to the town of Mucklefugger to live at their unclaimed estate. Aunt Tillie helps the wayward women of the town save their home; the Cradle, rebelling also against unscrupulous and incompetent town officials who endeavour to take over their estate. Accompanied by two lusty side-kicks, the film barely holds together with plot, digressing into many directions at times. Be warned, this is a silly movie. Cast includes Donald Pleasance, Yvonne Furneaux, Zsa Zsa Gabor and Miguel Angel Fuentes. WARNING: THE PICTURE JUMPS AT THE BEGINNING AND THERE IS SOME DROPOUT.
